251839499///infobox/UK/place////country///England//official_name//Dover//latitude//51.1295///longitude//1.3089//population///28,156//town//br//2001/census///shire_district//Dover///shire_county///Kent//region//South/East/England///Ambulance//South/East/Coast//constituency_westminster//Dover//post_town//DOVER//postcode_district///CT17///postcode_area//CT//dial_code//01304//os_grid_reference//TR315415////////div/class//dablink////This/article/is/about/the/English/port/town./For/the//larger/local/government/district,/see/District/of/Dover./For/other/uses/see//Dover//disambiguation/.//div////Dover//is/a/major/channel/port/in/the/English/county/of/Kent./At/the/2001/census,/the/town/of/Dover/proper/had/a/population/of/28,156/inhabitants,/while/the/population/of/the/whole/urban/area/of/Dover,/as/calculated/by/the/Office/for/National/Statistics,/was/39,078/inhabitants.//External/reference//[http///www.statistics.gov.uk/statbase/ssdataset.asp?vlnk/8271/More/Y]/./The/town/is/the/administrative/centre/of/the/Dover/district.//Dover/is/famous/for/its/white/cliffs,/which/are/made/of/chalk./The/cliffs/gave/Britain/its/nickname/of/[[Albion]],/meaning//white/./The/town/s/name/derives/from/the/Brythonic/Dubr//s///the/waters//.//Its/closeness/to/continental/Europe//ndash//it/is/only/34/kilometres//21/miles//from/the/French/port/of/Calais//ndash//makes/Dover/one/of/the/United/Kingdom/s/busiest/cross/Channel/ports,/with/18/million/passengers/passing/through/each/year./Regular/ferry/services/operate/from/Dover/to/Calais/and/Dunkerque./A/regular/catamaran/service/to/Boulogne/recommenced/in/May/2004./Catamaran/services/provided/by/Hoverspeed/to/Ostend/were/withdrawn/in/2003,/and/to/Calais/on/7/November/2005./Hoverspeed/had/previously/operated/hovercraft/services/to/and/from/Calais/and/Boulogne/for/many/years.//Dover/is/represented/in/Parliament/by/the/Labour/MP/Gwyn/Prosser.//Since/1836/the/town/of/Dover//originally/being/the/two/parishes/of/Dover/St./Mary/s/and/Dover/St./James//has/incorporated/the/ancient/villages/and/parishes/of/Buckland/and/Charlton./These/are/now/suburbs/of/the/town.//Most/of/the/western/half/of/the/town/is/in/Hougham/parish/and/a/small/part/of/the/eastern/section/and/Dover/Castle/are/in/Guston/parish///Maxton//was/once/a/hamlet/of/Hougham/parish/to/the/west/of/Dover,/and/the/terminus/of/the/tramway/system/serving/the/town/until/its/closure/in/1936./It/is/now/a/suburb/of/the/town.//History////As/the/closest/point/in/Britain/to/France,/Dover/has/been/strategically/important,/vulnerable/to/invasion/and/an/important/port/for/millennia.//Bronze/Age//In/1992,/a/waterlogged/boat/was/discovered/i
